awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Statistical Software and the Human   Interface - Symposium
awd_abstract_narration: This award will support the 1989 Symposium on the Interface                of Computing Science and Statistics to be held April 9-12, 1989                 in Orlando, Florida, organized by the Interface Foundation of                   North America, and hosted by the Department of Statistics of the                University of Central Florida.  The program will be centered                    around the theme of "statistical software and the human                         interface."  This conference is a continuation of the Interface                 Symposium series.  This year's program will include a collection                of sessions on departmental computing, the future of UNIX,                      graphics, high dimensional data structures, Bayesian computing,                 evaluating statistical software, regression diagnostics, quality                control and experimental design, vectorization, and many other                  topics.  One of the sessions will focus on the development of                   young investigators, where new Ph.D.'s will be invited to present               their dissertation results as invited papers.                                         The conference will consist of a keynote speech by                        Professor John Nelder, three parallel invited sessions, and a                   number of parallel contributed paper sessions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
